channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Blocked Drain Victoria Road Pavement, 15th January
item.description:
The drain on the pavement ramp on Victoria Road is blocked. Causing a large puddle in the pavement and the water runs down the pavement and into the doorways of the houses on Whitehorse hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible sink hole, 15th January
item.description:
There appears to be a potential sinkhole forming outside the garage on Pickford Lane, adjacent to Sainsbury’s. Following heavy rainfall today, a water-filled depression has developed in the road, which vehicles are currently driving through. The surrounding tarmac, particularly nearest the pavement, appears raised and uneven. Due to these conditions, there is concern that this may indicate the early stages of a sinkhole rather than a standard pothole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48A, Avenue Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement surface is uneven and badly deteriorated, with multiple cracks and sunken sections, 15th January
item.description:
Tree roots are lifting and distorting the tarmac, causing raised and sloping areas. There are also broken edges between paving slabs and tarmac, creating trip hazards. After rainfall, water pools in the depressions, increasing the risk of slips. This pavement presents a significant trip hazard, particularly for pedestrians, elderly people, wheelchair users, and those with prams or pushchairs. The uneven surface and root damage make it difficult to navigate safely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Avenue, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lamp post has been accidentally reversed into, 15th January
item.description:
The lamp post is leaning over, it has been cordoned off with tape.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Green, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near the edge of the road, under the bridge about halfway, 15th January
item.description:
The road is quite narrow so cyclists have to go over this and it is really deep and dangerous. It is near a draincover so it is deceptive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon House Road, Gospel Oak, Greater London

item.title: Middle of the street near the junction, 15th January
item.description:
This pothole is so dangerous for cyclists as it is never fixed and repaired properly, so it comes back within a few days and then it gets big and deep quickly so it is dangerous. Please can this be fixed properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22-24, Parkway, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sink hole Parkhill Road o/s 1 to 12 Stafford Court, 15th January
item.description:
A sink hole has appeared o.s Stafford Court on Parkhill Road. Resident has placed a cone in the road to try to get traffic avoid it. It is very dangerous. Please can this be looked at with a matter of urgency as cars are hitting the sink hole at 30 mph
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkhill Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chest of drawers and microwave, 15th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a chest of drawers and microwave on the street in front of Bruno Court. We checked with all the residents in the building and no-one knows about it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fassett Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
